perturbation.original_text: Licensor and Licensee are parties to that certain Distributor Agreement dated as of January 1, 1996 (the "Distributor Agreement").  Licensor and Licensee desire to amend the Distributor Agreement as set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensor and NEON are parties to that certain Distributor Agreement dated as of January 1, 1996 (the "Distributor Agreement").  Licensor and Licensee desire to amend the Distributor Agreement as set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Licensee' is replaced with 'NEON' in the first sentence, creating confusion as to whether 'Licensee' and 'NEON' are perfectly interchangeable throughout the document.

perturbation.original_text:
Licensee shall pay to Licensor for each Licensed Product licensed to a Redistributor or a Customer a







                         royalty equal to the Specified Royalty Percentage of







                         all revenues received (without deduction for value







                         added tax, if any, but excluding any revenues for







                         maintenance and support or upgrade services, which







                         revenues are covered in paragraph (b) below) by







                         Licensee under the Redistributor Agreement or







                         Sublicense applicable to such Licensed Product.
perturbation.changed_text:
NEON shall pay to Licensor for each Licensed Product licensed to a Redistributor or a Client a







                         royalty equal to the Specified Royalty Percentage of







                         all revenues received (without deduction for value







                         added tax, if any, but excluding any revenues for







                         maintenance and support or upgrade services, which







                         revenues are covered in paragraph (b) below) by







                         Licensee under the Redistributor Agreement or







                         Sublicense applicable to such Licensed Product.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Licensee' is replaced with 'NEON' and 'Customer' with 'Client'. It is now ambiguous who is actually responsible for the payment. Also, it's unclear whether 'Customer' and 'Client' refer to the same entity. This can lead to disputes on which party is legally obligated to pay royalties.

perturbation.original_text: The royalties payable to Licensor           pursuant to Section 3.1 shall be payable in accordance with the           provisions of this Section 3.2.  On or before the first day of each           fiscal quarter of each fiscal year during the term hereof, commencing           with the Licensee's fiscal year which begins on April 1, 1999,           Licensee shall pay to Licensor, as an advance (a "Royalty Advance") of           royalties anticipated to be paid hereunder during such fiscal year, an           amount equal to twenty-five percent (25%) of the Annual Royalty           Advance Requirement for such fiscal year.
perturbation.changed_text: The royalties payable to Licensor pursuant to Section 3.1 shall be payable in accordance with the provisions of this Section 3.2. On or before the first day of each fiscal quarter of each fiscal year during the term hereof, commencing with NEON's fiscal year which begins on April 1, 1999, The Distributor shall pay to Licensor, as an advance (a "Royalty Advance") of royalties anticipated to be paid hereunder during such fiscal year, an amount equal to twenty-five percent (25%) of the Annual Royalty Advance Requirement for such fiscal year.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Licensee' is replaced with 'NEON' and 'Licensee' is replaced with 'The Distributor'. It becomes unclear if 'The Distributor' is the same as 'NEON' or refers to some other party in the payment process. This creates uncertainty about who holds the financial obligations.
